definition: surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
Chen Yunlin (1941-), chairman of PRC Association for Relations Across the Taiwan Straits (ARATS) 海峽兩岸關係協會|海峡两岸关系协会[Hai3 xia2 Liang3 an4 Guan1 xi5 Xie2 hui4] (2008-2013)
Eason Chan (1974-), Hong Kong pop singer and actor
to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Edison Chen (1980-), Hong Kong singer and actor

sentences.english: Eric Suen Yiu Wai and Chan Fa La felt embarrassed when they were playing heartbeat measurement.
sentences.chinese: 孙耀威和陈法拉玩量度心跳，都感尴尬。

sentences.english: But Chen Qingyang came down the hill looking for me again.
sentences.chinese: 可是陈清扬又从山上跑下来找我。

sentences.english: I'am Chen Tianming , from Shanghai post and telecommuincate service development company, I'am direct of the company's overseas department.
sentences.chinese: 我是上海邮电服务发展公司还外部主任陈天明。

sentences.english: The authors suggest that the Chencai Group is one of the possible source bed for uranium deposits formed.
sentences.chinese: 作者认为，陈蔡群是形成铀矿床的可能铀源层之一。

sentences.english: In a few years' time, Chen's company reached a net profit of 200 million a year.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的几年，陈的公司年盈利达到了2亿元。

sentences.english: "That's a very big number, " Chen said.
sentences.chinese: 陈表示说“那是一个十分惊人的数据。”

sentences.english: Thanks for your wonderful lecture, President Chen.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢陈会长的精彩报告。

sentences.english: The manner to father had Chen Sanchuan to change gradually.
sentences.chinese: 陈三川对父亲的态度渐渐有了改观。

sentences.english: Labor and Social Security Department Director of the Center for Occupational accreditation Chen told reporters.
sentences.chinese: 劳动和社会保障部中心主任陈职业资格认证对记者说。

sentences.english: There have been no defaults so far, says the company’s founder, Calvin Chin.
sentences.chinese: 距公司创始人陈国权称迄今为止还没有拖欠记录。

sentences.english: The next morning, nurse Wu came to Mr. Chen's bedside.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早晨，吴来到了陈的病床边。

sentences.english: Eric was very excited to attend the same event with Chan Fa La.
sentences.chinese: 能够与陈法拉一起出席活动，孙耀威大感兴奋。

sentences.english: Chen Shisong, born in 1963 in Lufeng Guangdong Province.
sentences.chinese: 陈石松，1963年生于广东陆丰市。

sentences.english: "such a system, Chen referred to as" please Tian system.
sentences.chinese: 这种制度，陈教授简称为“请田制度”。

definition: (classical) a type of battle-ax/to kill/to slaughter
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms
surname Jiang/refers to Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
